metadata.title: CVE-2014-1729 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 3.24.35.22, asused in Google Chrome before 34.0.1847.116, allow attackers to cause adenial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-browser-l10n - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-chromedriver - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
